page.title: 04VISITING GRASSMOOR CENTRE
page.content: Before entering the galleries we were given protective helmets. We clipped lights to them and carried the heavy batteries in our hands. Once inside we were surprised how big the first tunnels were. We saw conveyor belts and large electricity generators. All was quiet except for men being given instructions along one of the tunnels. "Things are not always as quiet as this," said our guide switching on the machines. The noise was deafening. "We have controlled the problem of dust in the mines, but not that of noise," we were told. The tunnels got lower and soon we were moving on hands and knees It was dark and the lights on our hats pointed the way. A frienly voice greeted us at the end of the tunnel. Day light was lovely. It was just like being in a real coal mine. "I'll stick to teaching you nuisances," said Mr.K.
